page.title: 04WILDLIFE AND PLANTLIFE
page.content: Two thirds of Epping Forest is woodland.Beech,Birch,Hornbeam,and Oak are the only trees.Hawthorn and Blackthorn appear in the grassy plains. The forest also contains ponds and lakes.The trees used to be pollarded and coppiced. The wildlife includes Fallow Deer, Muntjac Deer,Foxes,Weasels,Stoats,Mice and Grey Squirrels.There are 60-80 Fallow Deer.There used to be Red Squirrels,but the Grey Squirrels replaced them. There is a Conservation centre at High Beech.This provides an educational course for all ages.Evening classes and public lectures are also avaliable.They supply maps etc of the area and give information about Epping Forest.
